text.p: These are the headlines selected from Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Busang a fraud, tests show: Scale of tampering with Bre-X gold samples 'without precedent,' consulting firm says.
- Bloc's campaign manager resigns: Changes made to end disarray.
- Manitoba vote won't be delayed: Date stays same Kingsley decides.
- Winnipeg dike walkers patrol for leaks: City employees watch walls that keep the capital safe.
- Mobutu rejects rebel demand to resign: Another meeting planned in eight to 10 days as Kabila's soldiers advance on Zaire's capital.
- Busang anomolies evident in '95: Report may provide insights into results of independent audit expected today from Bre-X.
- Wanted: High-tech workers: A dire shortage of software skills has prompted Ottawa to keep jobs in Canada by fast-tracking the import of young graduates from overseas.
- Quebec loses Asbestos case: Ontario orders minority buyout.
- Investors need clear head tapping craft beer stocks.
- The Bre-X countdown: Investors place final bets as mining and investment circles await Strathcona's report card on Busang.
- Investors favor phone companies in wide open telecom fight.
